attachments.title: Concern over Bash vulnerability grows as exploit reported “in the wild”
attachments.text: "Shellshock" bug in common GNU shell could be"worm-able," used to launch kernel exploits
attachments.fallback: Ars Technica: Concern over Bash vulnerability grows as exploit reported “in the wild”

text: And info on how to patch yo' Mac with the updated version: <http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/146849/how-do-i-recompile-bash-to-avoid-the-remote-exploit-cve-2014-6271-and-cve-2014-7/146851#146851>

attachments.title: How do I recompile Bash to avoid the remote exploit CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169?
attachments.text: Given the fact that Bash 3.2 (the version shipped by OSX) is vulnerable to the remote execution exploit CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169, how do I rebuild Bash and secure my system ahead of an offic...
